speedLimitGroup Get the speedlimits
Methods to get the speedlimits of the road, in positive resp.

negative direction.

  • byte getPosSpeedlimit () const
    Get the positive speedlimit (first -> last coordinate).
  • byte getNegSpeedlimit () const
    Get the negative speedlimit (last -> first coordinate).
levelgroup Get level relative groupd
Get the level of this road-polygon.

The level is relative the ground, e.g. tunnel has level -1 and bridge level 1.

  • int8 getLevel0 () const
    Get the level of the first coordinate (node0).
  • int8 getLevel1 () const
    Get the level of the last oordinate (node1).

Private Attributes

  • byte m_posSpeedLimit
    The speed limit of the road, when traversing it in positive direction (from the first coordinate to the last).
  • byte m_negSpeedLimit
    The speed limit of the road, when traversing it in negative direction (from the last coordinate to the first).
level Level for the nodes.
The level of the first and last coordinates in this polygon, relative ground.

Stored in 4 bits for internal use when rendering the map only. Only 2 bit when sending on network.

  • int8 m_level0: 4
    The level of the last coordinate, relative ground.
  • int8 m_level1: 4
    The level of the last coordinate, relative ground.
  • ItemTypes::entryrestriction_t m_entryrestrictions0: 2
    The regulations that are valid when entering this road polygon at the first coordinate (node 0).
  • ItemTypes::entryrestriction_t m_entryrestrictions1: 2
    The regulations that are valid when entering this road polygon at the last coordinate (node 1).
  • bool m_multidigitialized: 1
    True if the road is multidigitilized, false otherwise.
  • bool m_ramp: 1
    True if this road is ramp, false otherwise.
  • bool m_roundabout: 1
    True if this road represents a roundabout, false otherwise.

Detailed Description

A polygon of relative coordinates describing roads.

Contains attributes that are valid per polygon in the GfxRoadFeature. Some of the attributes are only valid in one of the directions, e.g. the speed limit attribute.

GfxRoadPolygon::GfxRoadPolygon (  bool  coordinates16Bits,
uint32  startSize,
byte  posSpeedLimit = 0,
byte  negSpeedLimit = 0,
bool  multidigitialized = false,
bool  ramp = false,
bool  roundabout = false,
int8  level0 = 0,
int8  level1 = 0,
ItemTypes::entryrestriction_t  entryrestr0 = ItemTypes::noRestrictions,
ItemTypes::entryrestriction_t  entryrestr1 = ItemTypes::noRestrictions
) 
 

Constructor, that initialize all the attrbutes.

Parameters:
coordinate16Bits True if 16 bits coordinates are used, false otherwise.
startSize The number of coordinates in this polygon. To be able to pre-allocate the vectors where the coordinates are stored. Optional.
posSpeedLimit The speed limit in positive direction.
negSpeedLimit The speed limit in negative direction.
multidigitialized True if this road is multidigitalized, false otherwise.
ramp True if this road is a ramp, false otherwise.
roundabout True if this road is part of a roundabout, false otherwise.
level0 The level, relative ground, of the first coordinate.
level1 The level, relative ground, of the last coordinate.
entryrestr0 The entry restrictions when entering the road at node 0.
entryrestr1 The entry restrictions when entering the road at node 1.
